alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Patchy freezing rain likely later tonight.

What:
Patchy freezing rain giving locally 1 to 2 mm of ice accretion.
Icy and slippery surfaces.

When:
Beginning late this evening or after midnight, and ending early Friday morning.

Additional information:
Patchy freezing rain is expected to develop tonight. Freezing rain amounts are not expected to be overly significant, but untreated surfaces are likely to become icy and slippery. Temperatures should rise above the freezing mark by early Friday morning.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas.

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Significant rainfall is possible this weekend. The frozen ground has a reduced ability to absorb this rainfall. 

What: 
Total rainfall amounts of 20 to 40 mm with locally higher amounts possible.

When: 
Saturday evening through Sunday night.

Additional information: 
Rain, at times heavy, is expected Saturday night into Sunday. With a risk of thunderstorms, local rainfall amounts in excess of 40 mm are possible over some areas.

Localized flooding in low-lying areas and water pooling on roads are possible. 

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Icy conditions Friday night into Sunday. Rain for some areas on Saturday.

What:
Ice accumulations of 1 to 4 mm possible.
Significant warm up with rain over some areas.

When:
Beginning Friday night and continuing through Saturday night.

Additional information:
Patchy freezing rain ahead of an approaching low pressure system may become more widespread on Saturday. The track of this low pressure system is still somewhat uncertain which will affect the precipitation types and amounts. Freezing rain warnings will be issued for some regions as confidence increases.

The precipitation could transition to periods of rain as temperatures rise above freezing Saturday afternoon from Pickle Lake extending northeast to Attawapiskat. The combination of melting snow and rain could result in water pooling in some areas.

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

affected_areas.area_description: Summer Beaver - Wunnummin Lake - Kingfisher Lake

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Prolonged freezing rain event is likely, beginning Friday morning continuing through Saturday.

What: 
Freezing rain with ice accumulations of 2 to 5 mm.

When:
Patchy freezing rain Friday morning into Friday night.
Widespread freezing rain Saturday morning continuing through Saturday afternoon.

Additional information: 
Patchy freezing rain possibly mixed with ice pellets or snow is expected Friday. Freezing rain will become heavier and more widespread early Saturday morning, continuing through the afternoon. Freezing rain will change to snow early Saturday evening. There is potential that areas near and south of Pickle Lake could change over to rain during this event, which would limit ice accumulation in these areas.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and extremely hazardous. Extended and widespread utility outages are possible.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Beware of branches or electrical wires that could break under the weight of ice.

Localized flooding in low-lying areas and water pooling on roads are possible. 

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Freezing rain is expected into this afternoon.

What: 
Freezing rain.
Ice accumulations of 1 to 3 mm on some surfaces. 

When:
From early this morning to this afternoon.

Additional information: 
Freezing rain possibly mixed with ice pellets or snow is expected beginning this morning. The freezing rain is expected to change over to showers late this morning or afternoon as temperatures rise above zero degrees.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas.

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Patchy freezing rain likely late this morning and afternoon.

What: 
Patchy freezing rain giving locally 1 to 2 mm of ice accretion.
Icy and slippery surfaces.

When:
Late this morning into the afternoon.

Additional information: 
Patchy freezing rain is expected to affect portions of the area later this morning into the afternoon. Freezing rain amounts are not expected to be overly significant, but untreated surfaces are likely to become icy and slippery. Temperatures should rise above the freezing mark later this afternoon.

For areas well to the north of Fraserdale, temperatures may remain just below the freezing mark until later tonight. As a result, the threat of freezing rain may continue tonight.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas.

alerts.headline: winter storm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Winter storm conditions possible tonight and Saturday. Patchy freezing rain is possible today.

What: 
Freezing rain with ice accumulations of 2 to 4 mm.
Snowfall amounts near 15 cm possible. 
Reduced visibility in snow and blowing snow.

When: 
Tonight into Saturday night.

Additional information: 
Patchy freezing rain is possible today. Freezing rain will become become heavier and more widespread tonight and will be mixed with ice pellets at times. There is potential that areas over southern portions of the region may change over to rain this afternoon and this evening. All precipitation will change over to snow by late Saturday morning, with gusty winds leading to reduced visibility at times.

There remains some uncertainty with the track of this low pressure system which may affect snowfall amounts and precipitation types.

###

Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery.

Winter storm watches are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Prolonged freezing rain event is likely, beginning this morning continuing through Saturday.

What: 
Freezing rain with ice accumulations of 2 to 5 mm.

When:
Patchy freezing rain this morning into tonight.
Widespread freezing rain Saturday morning continuing through Saturday afternoon.

Additional information: 
Patchy freezing rain possibly mixed with ice pellets or snow is expected today. Freezing rain will become heavier and more widespread early Saturday morning, continuing through the afternoon. Freezing rain will change to snow early Saturday evening. There is potential that areas near and south of Pickle Lake could change over to rain during this event, which would limit ice accumulation in these areas.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous. Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break. Utility outages may occur.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. Beware of branches or electrical wires that could break under the weight of ice.

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Wintry conditions tonight into Sunday. Rain for some areas on Saturday.

What:
Ice accumulations of 1 to 4 mm possible.
Warm up with rain over some areas.

When:
Beginning tonight and continuing through Saturday night.

Additional information:
Snow at times mixed with ice pellets will move into the region this afternoon or tonight. While there is a risk of freezing rain tonight for some areas, more widespread freezing rain is expected to develop Saturday morning or afternoon. 
Precipitation towards Attawapiskat will change over to rain Saturday afternoon as temperature rises above the freezing mark. The combination of melting snow and rain could result in water pooling in some areas.

The track of this low pressure system is still somewhat uncertain which will affect the precipitation types and amounts. Freezing rain warnings will be issued for some regions as confidence increases.

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

affected_areas.area_description: Summer Beaver - Wunnummin Lake - Kingfisher Lake

alerts.headline: winter storm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Winter storm conditions possible on Saturday.

What: 
Total snowfall amounts near 15 cm possible. 
Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow.
Risk of freezing rain. 

When: 
Early Saturday morning into Saturday night.

Additional information: 
A Colorado low could bring a wintry mix of precipitation across the region on Saturday. The precipitation is expected to begin as rain in some areas with amounts of 10 of 20 mm possible. The rain is expected to become mixed with ice pellets or freezing rain, then transition to snow which could be heavy at times. Northerly wind gusts up to 60 km/h could result in blowing snow. The track of this low pressure system is still somewhat uncertain which will affect exact snowfall amounts and precipitation types.

###

Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery.

Winter storm watches are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Freezing rain tonight into Saturday morning.

What:
Ice accumulations of 1 to 3 mm possible.

When:
Beginning tonight and continuing into Saturday morning.

Additional information:
Snow will develop this afternoon and change to freezing rain at times mixed with ice pellets this evening. Freezing rain is expected to change over to rain Saturday morning as temperatures rise above the freezing mark.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous. Utility outages may occur.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas.

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Freezing rain tonight into Saturday night.

What:
Ice accumulations of 2 to 5 mm possible.

When:
Beginning tonight and continuing through Saturday night.

Additional information:
Patchy freezing rain or freezing drizzle is possible today. Freezing rain will become more widespread tonight and will be mixed with ice pellets and snow at times. Temperatures are expected to rise above the freezing mark on Saturday for most areas, however it is possible that Lansdowne House may remain below the freezing mark throughout the day. Where temperatures rise above the freezing mark lower ice accumulations are expected.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous. Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break. Utility outages may occur.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Beware of branches or electrical wires that could break under the weight of ice.
